Class BootStrapNodeImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
      • java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
        • java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
          • BootStrapNodeImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BootStrapNode, java.rmi.Remote

    public class BootStrapNodeImpl
extends java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
implements BootStrapNode
    This class serves as the starting point for the BootStrap server and has functions to assist in node joins and departure while also serves the purpose of collecting metrics for the improvements made.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • addNodeToRing

        public java.util.ArrayList<NodeInfo> addNodeToRing​(java.lang.String ipaddress,
                                                   java.lang.String port)
                                            throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Description copied from interface: BootStrapNode
        This function will be called by any Chord Node that wishes to join the network. The main objective of this function is to assign a unique identifier to a new Chord Node and add it the the ring. Other than this it also implements the two different methods on how to be assigned identifiers based on network proximity.
        Specified by:
        addNodeToRing in interface BootStrapNode
        Parameters:
        ipaddress - The IP Address of the Chord Node joining the ring
        port - The port/identifier of Chord Node instance joining the ring. This differentiates multiple instance running on same system
        Returns:
        ArrayList The list with metrics used to test the protocol.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Due to RMI.

        Description copied from interface: BootStrapNode

        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        n - NodeInfo object storing details of the Chord Node instance
        Throws:

      • findNewSuccessor

        public NodeInfo findNewSuccessor​(NodeInfo n,
                                 NodeInfo dead_node)
                          throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Description copied from interface: BootStrapNode
        This function finds the new successor node if the current successor node is found to be dead or has crashed.
        Specified by:
        findNewSuccessor in interface BootStrapNode
        Parameters:
        n - NodeInfo object storing details of the Chord Node instance whose successor is to be found
        dead_node - NodeInfo object of the Chord Node instance which is dead
        Returns:
        succ NodeInfo object of the new successor Chord Node
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Due to RMI.

      • generate_ID

        public int generate_ID​(java.lang.String key,
                       int maxNodes)
                throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                       java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Description copied from interface: BootStrapNode
        The function generates a unique identifier for the Chord Node instance using SHA-1 algorithm
        Specified by:
        generate_ID in interface BootStrapNode
        Parameters:
        key - The key with which the unique identifier is to be generated using SHA-1
        maxNodes - The maximum number of nodes in the ring
        Returns:
        int Unique identifier for the Chord Node
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Due to RMI.
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - Due to SHA-1 usage.

      • isZoneFilled

        public boolean isZoneFilled​(int zoneID)
                     throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Description copied from interface: BootStrapNode
        This function checks if a particular zone of the Chord ring is full ,i.e. all the slots are occupied by CHord Node instances
        Specified by:
        isZoneFilled in interface BootStrapNode
        Parameters:
        zoneID - The zone number in the Chord ring. Allowed range is 0 to (m-1).
        Returns:
        is_filled Boolean value indicating is zone is full or not. True indicates full.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Due to RMI.
